Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek pottery plate; glaze fired orange, no assured traces of added colour; slipped inside; broken maeander band on top of rim; at outside of floor frieze of concentric circles and leaves connected by horizontal bars between bands; perhaps maeander band to the centre. On outside of rim glaze billets, two irregularly placed. Exterior: three bands at top of wall, one preserved lower down. Two holes with unusual square section in rim.
Curator's comments: Same pattern on the handle-plate of a column-krater in Oxford (Ashmolean, G119.48) published in CVA Oxford 2, (II D), p. 79, no. 24, pl. IV.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1180)
